attributes.action: Review the way in which parking fines are administered and upheld.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe that, in much the same way that extortionate bank charges are unlawful, parking fines are administered and upheld with a zero-tolerance approach, often fuelled by commission driven attendants, and are in most cases simply a means in which local authorities can make "easy money".

As we all know, the vast majority of vehicles which are parked for longer than the allocated time are produced with a parking ticket within only a couple of minutes.

I suggest as means of a "gesture of good faith" or "benefit of the doubt" action by local authorities, to allow the offender to buy a ticket which he or she must produce to a local authority office which would cover the parking for the period of which the offender had not originally purchased a ticket for.
